      31             : namespace mozilla {

      33             : 
      34             : /**
      35             :  * Returns true if code running in the given JSContext is allowed to access
      36             :  * [SecureContext] API on the given JSObject.
      37             :  *
      38             :  * [SecureContext] API exposure is restricted to use by code in a Secure
      39             :  * Contexts:
      40             :  *
      41             :  *   https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-secure-contexts/
      42             :  *
      43             :  * Since we want [SecureContext] exposure to depend on the privileges of the
      44             :  * running code (rather than the privileges of an object's creator), this
      45             :  * function checks to see whether the given JSContext's Compartment is flagged
      46             :  * as a Secure Context.  That allows us to make sure that system principal code
      47             :  * (which is marked as a Secure Context) can access Secure Context API on an
      48             :  * object in a different compartment, regardless of whether the other
      49             :  * compartment is a Secure Context or not.
      50             :  *
      51             :  * Checking the JSContext's Compartment doesn't work for expanded principal
      52             :  * globals accessing a Secure Context web page though (e.g. those used by frame
      53             :  * scripts).  To handle that we fall back to checking whether the JSObject came
      54             :  * from a Secure Context.
      55             :  *
      56             :  * Note: We'd prefer this function to live in BindingUtils.h, but we need to
      57             :  * call it in this header, and BindingUtils.h includes us (i.e. we'd have a
      58             :  * circular dependency between headers if it lived there).
      59             :  */
      60             : inline bool
      61           0 : IsSecureContextOrObjectIsFromSecureContext(JSContext* aCx, JSObject* aObj)
      62             : {
      63           0 :   return JS::CompartmentCreationOptionsRef(js::GetContextCompartment(aCx)).secureContext() ||
      64           0 :          JS::CompartmentCreationOptionsRef(js::GetObjectCompartment(aObj)).secureContext();
      65             : }

     172             : 
     173             : // Conceptually, NativeProperties has seven (Prefable<T>*, jsid*, T*) trios
     174             : // (where T is one of JSFunctionSpec, JSPropertySpec, or ConstantSpec), one for
     175             : // each of: static methods and attributes, methods and attributes, unforgeable
     176             : // methods and attributes, and constants.
     177             : //
     178             : // That's 21 pointers, but in most instances most of the trios are all null,
     179             : // and there are many instances. To save space we use a variable-length type,
     180             : // NativePropertiesN<N>, to hold the data and getters to access it. It has N
     181             : // actual trios (stored in trios[]), plus four bits for each of the 7 possible
     182             : // trios: 1 bit that states if that trio is present, and 3 that state that
     183             : // trio's offset (if present) in trios[].
     184             : //
     185             : // All trio accesses should be done via the getters, which contain assertions
     186             : // that check we don't overrun the end of the struct. (The trio data members are
     187             : // public only so they can be statically initialized.) These assertions should
     188             : // never fail so long as (a) accesses to the variable-length part are guarded by
     189             : // appropriate Has*() calls, and (b) all instances are well-formed, i.e. the
     190             : // value of N matches the number of mHas* members that are true.
     191             : //
     192             : // Finally, we define a typedef of NativePropertiesN<7>, NativeProperties, which
     193             : // we use as a "base" type used to refer to all instances of NativePropertiesN.
     194             : // (7 is used because that's the maximum valid parameter, though any other
     195             : // value 1..6 could also be used.) This is reasonable because of the
     196             : // aforementioned assertions in the getters. Upcast() is used to convert
     197             : // specific instances to this "base" type.
     198             : //
     199             : template <int N>
     200             : struct NativePropertiesN {
     201             :   // Trio structs are stored in the trios[] array, and each element in the
     202             :   // array could require a different T. Therefore, we can't use the correct
     203             :   // type for mPrefables and mSpecs. Instead we use void* and cast to the
     204             :   // correct type in the getters.
     205             :   struct Trio {
     206             :     const /*Prefable<const T>*/ void* const mPrefables;
     207             :     const jsid* const mIds;
     208             :     const /*T*/ void* const mSpecs;
     209             :   };
     210             : 
     211             :   const int32_t iteratorAliasMethodIndex;
     212             : 
     213             :   constexpr const NativePropertiesN<7>* Upcast() const {
     214             :     return reinterpret_cast<const NativePropertiesN<7>*>(this);
     215             :   }
     216             : 
     217             : #define DO(SpecT, FieldName) \
     218             : public: \
     219             :   /* The bitfields indicating the trio's presence and (if present) offset. */ \
     220             :   const uint32_t mHas##FieldName##s:1; \
     221             :   const uint32_t m##FieldName##sOffset:3; \
     222             : private: \
     223             :   const Trio* FieldName##sTrio() const { \
     224             :     MOZ_ASSERT(Has##FieldName##s()); \
     225             :     return &trios[m##FieldName##sOffset]; \
     226             :   } \
     227             : public: \
     228             :   bool Has##FieldName##s() const { \
     229             :     return mHas##FieldName##s; \
     230             :   } \
     231             :   const Prefable<const SpecT>* FieldName##s() const { \
     232             :     return static_cast<const Prefable<const SpecT>*> \
     233             :                       (FieldName##sTrio()->mPrefables); \
     234             :   } \
     235             :   const jsid* FieldName##Ids() const { \
     236             :     return FieldName##sTrio()->mIds; \
     237             :   } \
     238             :   const SpecT* FieldName##Specs() const { \
     239             :     return static_cast<const SpecT*>(FieldName##sTrio()->mSpecs); \
     240             :   }
     241             : 
     242         480 :   DO(JSFunctionSpec, StaticMethod)
     243         360 :   DO(JSPropertySpec, StaticAttribute)
     244         540 :   DO(JSFunctionSpec, Method)
     245         540 :   DO(JSPropertySpec, Attribute)
     246           0 :   DO(JSFunctionSpec, UnforgeableMethod)
     247           0 :   DO(JSPropertySpec, UnforgeableAttribute)
     248         780 :   DO(ConstantSpec,   Constant)
     249             : 
     250             : #undef DO
     251             : 
     252             :   const Trio trios[N];
     253             : };
     254             : 
     255             : // Ensure the struct has the expected size. The 8 is for the
     256             : // iteratorAliasMethodIndex plus the bitfields; the rest is for trios[].
     257             : static_assert(sizeof(NativePropertiesN<1>) == 8 +  3*sizeof(void*), "1 size");
     258             : static_assert(sizeof(NativePropertiesN<2>) == 8 +  6*sizeof(void*), "2 size");
     259             : static_assert(sizeof(NativePropertiesN<3>) == 8 +  9*sizeof(void*), "3 size");
     260             : static_assert(sizeof(NativePropertiesN<4>) == 8 + 12*sizeof(void*), "4 size");
     261             : static_assert(sizeof(NativePropertiesN<5>) == 8 + 15*sizeof(void*), "5 size");
     262             : static_assert(sizeof(NativePropertiesN<6>) == 8 + 18*sizeof(void*), "6 size");
     263             : static_assert(sizeof(NativePropertiesN<7>) == 8 + 21*sizeof(void*), "7 size");
     264             :

     274             : // Helper structure for Xrays for DOM binding objects. The same instance is used
     275             : // for instances, interface objects and interface prototype objects of a
     276             : // specific interface.
     277             : struct NativePropertyHooks
     278             : {
     279             :   // The hook to call for resolving indexed or named properties. May be null if
     280             :   // there can't be any.
     281             :   ResolveOwnProperty mResolveOwnProperty;
     282             :   // The hook to call for enumerating indexed or named properties. May be null
     283             :   // if there can't be any.
     284             :   EnumerateOwnProperties mEnumerateOwnProperties;
     285             :   // The hook to call to delete a named property.  May be null if there are no
     286             :   // named properties or no named property deleter.  On success (true return)
     287             :   // the "found" argument will be set to true if there was in fact such a named
     288             :   // property and false otherwise.  If it's set to false, the caller is expected
     289             :   // to proceed with whatever deletion behavior it would have if there were no
     290             :   // named properties involved at all (i.e. if the hook were null).  If it's set
     291             :   // to true, it will indicate via opresult whether the delete actually
     292             :   // succeeded.
     293             :   DeleteNamedProperty mDeleteNamedProperty;
     294             : 
     295             :   // The property arrays for this interface.
     296             :   NativePropertiesHolder mNativeProperties;
     297             : 
     298             :   // This will be set to the ID of the interface prototype object for the
     299             :   // interface, if it has one. If it doesn't have one it will be set to
     300             :   // prototypes::id::_ID_Count.
     301             :   prototypes::ID mPrototypeID;
     302             : 
     303             :   // This will be set to the ID of the interface object for the interface, if it
     304             :   // has one. If it doesn't have one it will be set to
     305             :   // constructors::id::_ID_Count.
     306             :   constructors::ID mConstructorID;
     307             : 
     308             :   // The NativePropertyHooks instance for the parent interface (for
     309             :   // ShimInterfaceInfo).
     310             :   const NativePropertyHooks* mProtoHooks;

     312             :   // The JSClass to use for expandos on our Xrays.  Can be null, in which case
     313             :   // Xrays will use a default class of their choice.
